word: the pot calling the kettle black

meanings.meaning_en_US: A situation in which someone criticizes another for a fault they themselves possess.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個人批評另一個人有自己擁有的缺點

examples.sentence: When he called her lazy, it was just [the pot calling the kettle black].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他叫她懶惰時，這簡直就是在自我矛盾。

examples.sentence: Often, [the pot calls the kettle black] when he criticizes others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他批評別人時，經常是自相矛盾。

examples.sentence: It's ironic when someone unpunctual points out others' tardiness; it's [the pot calling the kettle black].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當一個不守時的人指出別人遲到時，這真是諷刺，這簡直是在自我矛盾。

word: you made your bed, now lie in it

meanings.meaning_en_US: You must accept the consequences of your actions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你必須承擔自己行動的後果

examples.sentence: You chose to skip the meeting; [you made your bed, now lie in it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你選擇了跳過會議；你必須承擔自己行動的後果。

examples.sentence: [You made your bed, now lie in it] applies when facing the results of poor choices.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當面對不好的選擇後果時，這句話很適用。

examples.sentence: After making that decision, [you made your bed, now lie in it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做出那個決定後，你必須承擔自己行動的後果。

word: a picture paints a thousand words

meanings.meaning_en_US: An image can convey a complex idea more effectively than words.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法

examples.sentence: Looking at the photo, I thought, [a picture paints a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看著這張照片，我想，一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法。

examples.sentence: In presentations, remember that often [a picture paints a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在簡報中，記得通常一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法。

examples.sentence: She explained the idea clearly, but [a picture paints a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她清楚地解釋了這個想法，但其實一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法。

word: birds of a feather flock together

meanings.meaning_en_US: People with similar interests or characteristics tend to associate with each other.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫

examples.sentence: In the art community, [birds of a feather flock together].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在藝術社區中，有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫。

examples.sentence: You’ll find that [birds of a feather flock together] in most social groups.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你會發現，在大多數社交圈中，有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫。

examples.sentence: In clubs, it's clear that [birds of a feather flock together].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在俱樂部中，明顯有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫。

word: if you can’t beat them, join them

meanings.meaning_en_US: If you cannot defeat an opponent, it might be easier to become part of them.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果你無法擊敗對手，那麼加入他們可能會更簡單

examples.sentence: He wanted to change the system, but realized [if you can’t beat them, join them].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想改變體系，但意識到如果你無法擊敗對手，那麼加入他們可能會更簡單。

examples.sentence: In competitive markets, sometimes [if you can’t beat them, join them] works best.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在競爭激烈的市場中，有時如果你無法擊敗對手，那麼加入他們可能會更簡單。

examples.sentence: She found herself understanding that [if you can’t beat them, join them] was practical.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她發現，接受對手，加入他們可能會更簡單，這是實際的。

word: keep one’s nose to the grindstone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To work hard and diligently.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 努力且勤奮地工作

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, you’ll need to [keep one’s nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你希望成功，你需要努力且勤奮地工作。

examples.sentence: He believes that [keeping one’s nose to the grindstone] leads to success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信努力且勤奮地工作會帶來成功。

examples.sentence: To reach her goals, she knows she must [keep her nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了達成她的目標，她知道自己必須努力且勤奮地工作。

word: make a mountain out of a molehill

meanings.meaning_en_US: To exaggerate the significance of a minor issue.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 誇大小問題的重要性

examples.sentence: She tends to [make a mountain out of a molehill] when stressed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她壓力大時，往往會誇大小問題的重要性。

examples.sentence: Don’t [make a mountain out of a molehill] over a simple misunderstanding.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要因為小誤會而誇大問題的重要性。

examples.sentence: He always [makes a mountain out of a molehill] with small inconveniences.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是對一些小不便誇大其詞。

word: not the sharpest tool in the shed

meanings.meaning_en_US: Referring to someone who is not very smart or clever.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 指一個人不是特別聰明或機靈

examples.sentence: He’s nice, but he’s [not the sharpest tool in the shed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他很好，但他的智力不是特別聰明。

examples.sentence: Sometimes people forget that he’s [not the sharpest tool in the shed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時人們會忘記他不是特別聰明。

examples.sentence: Don’t take it personally; he’s just [not the sharpest tool in the shed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要放在心上；他只是沒有特別聰明。

word: the squeaky wheel gets the grease

meanings.meaning_en_US: The problem that gets the most attention is often the one that is addressed first.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最受關注的問題往往是最先被解決的
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 安靜的輪子不需要油脂
不必要的問題會被忽略

examples.sentence: If you want a raise, you should [be the squeaky wheel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想要加薪，你應該表現得引人注意。

examples.sentence: In a meeting, the person who [is the squeaky wheel] usually gets heard.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，最受關注的人通常會被聽到。

examples.sentence: Sometimes you have to [be the squeaky wheel] to get what you need.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候你必須引起注意才能得到你所需要的。

word: time flies when you’re having fun

meanings.meaning_en_US: Time seems to pass more quickly when you are enjoying yourself.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 當你享受生活時，時間似乎過得特別快

examples.sentence: It’s hard to believe that the weekend is over; [time flies when you’re having fun].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 難以相信週末就結束了；當你享受時，時間過得特別快。

examples.sentence: When we were at the amusement park, [time flew] by so quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我們在遊樂園時，時間過得特別快。

examples.sentence: I lost track of time while we were chatting; [time flies when you’re having fun].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們聊天時我忘了時間；當你享受時，時間過得特別快。

word: when in rome, do as the romans do

meanings.meaning_en_US: You should adapt to the customs of the places you visit.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你應該適應你所訪問地區的習俗

examples.sentence: While traveling, I always remember that [when in rome, do as the romans do].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 旅行時，我總是記得要適應當地的習俗。

examples.sentence: She learned to enjoy local dishes because [when in rome, do as the romans do].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她學會享受當地美食，因為要適應當地的習俗。

examples.sentence: We tried to dress appropriately because [when in rome, do as the romans do].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們努力穿著得體，因為應該適應當地的習俗。

word: where there’s smoke, there’s fire

meanings.meaning_en_US: If there are signs that something is wrong, there is likely a real problem.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題

examples.sentence: The rumors might be true; [where there’s smoke, there’s fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些謠言可能是真的；如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題。

examples.sentence: People are starting to wonder; [where there’s smoke, there’s fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們開始懷疑；如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題。

examples.sentence: She decided to investigate because [where there’s smoke, there’s fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定調查，因為如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題。

word: a leopard doesn’t change its spots

meanings.meaning_en_US: People cannot change their innate nature.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人無法改變其天生的性格

examples.sentence: You shouldn't trust him; [a leopard doesn’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不該信任他；人無法改變其天生的性格。

examples.sentence: She always ends up doing the same thing; [a leopard doesn’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是做同樣的事情；人無法改變其天生的性格。

examples.sentence: You can see his old habits; [a leopard doesn’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以看到他的舊習慣；人無法改變其天生的性格。

word: always a bridesmaid, never a bride

meanings.meaning_en_US: Refers to someone who is often in supportive roles but never reaches their own goals.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人

examples.sentence: She’s been in many relationships but remains single; [always a bridesmaid, never a bride].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她有過很多段關係，但仍然單身；指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人。

examples.sentence: In her career, she helps others succeed but has not advanced herself; [always a bridesmaid, never a bride].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的職業生涯中，她幫助其他人成功，但自己卻未能晉升；指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人。

examples.sentence: Despite her talents, she feels [always a bridesmaid, never a bride].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管她的才能出眾，她仍感到自己是個失敗者；指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人。

word: butter wouldn’t melt in your mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: Describes someone who appears innocent or demure but may be the opposite.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人

examples.sentence: She acts so prim and proper; [butter wouldn’t melt in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她表現得如此端莊；形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人。

examples.sentence: He seems sweet and shy; [butter wouldn’t melt in his mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他看起來甜美而害羞；形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人。

examples.sentence: You shouldn't be fooled; [butter wouldn’t melt in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不應該被欺騙；形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人。

word: can’t see the forest for the trees

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being too involved in the details of a problem to see the overall situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 過於專注於問題的細節而無法看清全局

examples.sentence: In her analysis, she missed the bigger picture; [can’t see the forest for the trees].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的分析中，她錯過了整體情況；過於專注於問題的細節而無法看清全局。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, people [can’t see the forest for the trees] when dealing with problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，人們在處理問題時會過於專注細節而無法看清全局。

examples.sentence: You need to step back; otherwise, you’ll [can’t see the forest for the trees].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要退一步；否則，你會過於專注於細節而無法看清全局。

word: don’t bite the hand that feeds you

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not harm those who help you.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要傷害那些幫助你的人

examples.sentence: Make sure to stay respectful; [don’t bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保對人尊重；不要傷害那些幫助你的人。

examples.sentence: He criticized his boss for years; [don’t bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他批評他的上司多年；不要傷害那些幫助你的人。

examples.sentence: Remember, [don’t bite the hand that feeds you] if you wish to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，如果你想成功，千萬不要傷害那些幫助你的人。

word: give someone a run for their money

meanings.meaning_en_US: To challenge someone or provide strong competition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 向某人挑戰或提供強有力的競爭

examples.sentence: He promised to [give her a run for her money] in the upcoming race.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他承諾在即將到來的比賽中向她挑戰。

examples.sentence: The new team member is sure to [give the old one a run for their money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新成員肯定會向舊成員挑戰。

examples.sentence: If you train hard, you’ll [give your opponents a run for their money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你努力訓練，你就能挑戰對手。

word: good things come to those who wait

meanings.meaning_en_US: Patience is often rewarded.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 耐心往往會得到獎賞

examples.sentence: Don’t rush into decisions; [good things come to those who wait].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要急於做決定；耐心往往會得到獎賞。

examples.sentence: In life, [good things come to those who wait] applies to relationships too.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，耐心往往會得到獎賞，這也適用於人際關係。

examples.sentence: She learned that [good things come to those who wait] after many trials.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過多次考驗後，她明白了耐心往往會得到獎賞。

word: have eyes in the back of your head

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very aware of what is happening around you, even behind you.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常清楚發生在你周圍的事情，甚至是背後的事情

examples.sentence: As a teacher, you need to [have eyes in the back of your head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 作為一名老師，你需要非常清楚發生在你周圍的事情，甚至是背後的事情。

examples.sentence: In a busy restaurant, the manager must [have eyes in the back of their head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一家繁忙的餐廳中，經理必須非常清楚周圍的情況，甚至是背後的事情。

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed in business, you must [have eyes in the back of your head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想在商業中成功，你必須非常清楚四周的情況。
